Title: Bayelsa to host national bodybuilding championship in October
Summary: Bayelsa State is set to host the Amateur Bodybuilding and Fitness Federation Nigeria (ABBFN) Ultimate Night of Champions from Oct. 3 to Oct. 5 at the Chief D.S.P. Alamieyeseigha Banquet Hall in Yenagoa .

Title: Hotel to reward clients who get pregnant during stay in its building
Summary: Polish real estate group hopes to tackle the country's falling birth rate by rewarding clients who conceive babies in its hotels . Arche group owns 23 hotels and numerous buildings across the country .

Title: Mourinho celebrates Benfica return with convincing win
Summary: Jose Mourinho celebrates Benfica return with convincing 3-0 win at AVS on Saturday . Mourinho returns to his second spell in charge of the Portuguese giants .

Title: $100,000 H-1B visa fee only for new applicants – White House
Summary: A $100,000 fee will be a “one-time” payment imposed only on new applicants . The White House issued a major clarification Saturday to its new H-1B visa policy .

Title: Babcock, Sycom seal landmark cybersecurity training partnership
Summary: Babcock University has signed a groundbreaking Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Sycom Integrated Solutions Limited to revolutionize cybersecurity education and skills development in Nigeria . The five-year agreement, signed on Thursday, September 18, 2025, will establish an industry-driven cybersecurity training program .

Title: They took from us Aso Rock site where we made spiritual consultations – Abuja indigenous people
Summary: Indigenous people in The Federal Capital Territory (FCT) continue to fight for recognition . They took from us Aso Rock site where we made spiritual consultations – Abuja indigenous people .

Title: If I wanted third term, I would’ve gotten it — Obasanjo
Summary: Obasanjo also cautioned against leaders clinging to power, stressing that such behaviour reflects a false sense of indispensability . The former president also warned against leaders clinging to power .

Title: Thelma, Bright evicted from BBNaija house
Summary: Big Brother Naija housemates, Thelma Lawson and Bright Morgan, have been evicted from the reality show . Their exit was announced shortly after the Saturday night party . Bright’s in-house lover, Mide, broke down in tears following his departure . Kaybobo, who had grown close to Thel

Title: Nigeria needs citizens with character, not just soldiers with weapons – Marwa
Summary: Retired Brig.-Gen. Buba Marwa urged Nigerians to uphold discipline, loyalty and resilience . Marwa made the call in Abuja on Saturday night at the 38th anniversary of the Nigerian Military School (NMS) Class of 1982 .

Title: AFRILAND Towers: 20 things you didn’t know about Lagos fire incident
Summary: Chukwunonso Okafor, Head, Brand, Marketing and Corporate Communications of Afriland Properties, provides 20 Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) on the fire incident clarifying some of the misinformation trending online . What caused the fire? The fire originated in the inverter room located in the basement . Safety protocols were

Title: Ghost refineries: P’Harcourt, Warri, Kaduna plants rot as workers turn idle
Summary: Refineries in Port Harcourt, Kaduna and Warri are rotting away despite $3bn contract sum to resuscitate them . Nigerian National Petroleum Company Limited has overseen multiple rehabilitation efforts since the early 2000s, with promises of operational revival repeatedly unmet . Economic and Financial Crimes Commission has launched an investigation into the refineries .

Title: How cooking with alcohol triggers heart attack
Summary: Public health experts have expressed concerns over the rising trend of spicing meals with alcohol and cannabis . They warned that what may seem like culinary creativity could endanger lives, especially those of vulnerable groups such as children, pregnant women, and people with underlying medical conditions . The experts cautioned that alcohol used in cooking does not always fully evaporate .

Title: Ondo general hospital where pregnant women dread to give birth
Summary: Igbara-Oke General Hospital in Ondo State has become a symbol of neglect and failure due to acute shortages of doctors, drugs, equipment, and failing infrastructure . Pregnant women accessing antenatal care at the facility fear the deprivation of quality healthcare could endanger their lives .

Title: Earwax and its problems
Summary: Excessive earwax, also known as cerumen, can be a problem when it builds up and causes a range of issues both psychologically and physically . A normal amount of it is beneficial and helps to maintain ear health by assisting the ear to keep itself clean . It often does not need any treatment or removal when it appears to be

Title: My three-year-old son was abducted while playing football – Father
Summary: Salmon Ajuwon, a distressed businessman and father of two, speaks with Ajibade Omape about his 3-year-old son, Rohan, who was abducted on August 28, 2025, while playing football outside their compound in Matogun, Ogun State .
